titleInfo.title: PZ 5098/39 'Position of Major G S de Gaury vis-á-vis military service in the event of war'

physicalDescription.extent: The contents of this file are arranged in reverse chronological order.

Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 8; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence relating to Major Gerald Simpson Rutland Hillairet Vere de Gaury, the Political Agent in Kuwait, and the possibility that he will be called up for military service. Letters between De Gaury; Roland Tennyson Peel (Secretary for the Political Department in the India Office), the Government of India External Affairs Department, and Trenchard Craven Fowle (Political Resident in the Persian Gulf), aim to ensure that De Gaury is not requested to serve in the military as he is holding a 'key appointment' within the India Office. Herbert James Greedy in the War Office issues a letter in September 1939 (folio 2) to confirm that De Gaury will not be enlisted.
